#Text=Japan government panel urges reinterpretation of pacifist constitution
#Text=Saturday , February 8 , 2014
#Text=File photo of Shinzo Abe in 2010 .
#Text=Image : 多摩に暇人 .

#Text=A Japan government panel met last Tuesday and is drafting a report aimed to urge Japan to loosen restrictions on participation in military combat — restriction of military to self-defense — imposed in its constitution since the end of World War II .
#Text=They expected to finalize the report after April .
#Text=North Korea reacted by calling the Prime Minister of Japan , Shinzo Abe , an " Asian Hitler " on Wednesday .

#Text=The government panel — fourteen members headed by Shunji Yanai , former ambassador to the US — sought ways to reinterpret the constitution on the grounds there was not enough public support for revising , or rewriting , the constitution itself .
#Text=Shinzo Abe said he was motivated to help keep international peace — by protecting other nations ' troops , which was beyond the scope currently allowed under the constitution .
#Text=He interpreted it as a country 's right , commenting , " it 's about whether we can exercise this right that every country has " .
#Text=During the Tuesday meeting , Abe also expressed a concern that the country 's national security was not ready for potential regional conflicts :
#Text=" Japan 's preparation for national security threats in the region is not sufficient .

#Text=The editorial followed a comment by Rodong Sinmun , the ruling party — Workers ' Party of Korea — newspaper , which described Abe as a  militarist maniac " last month .

column1: #Text=The reaction was also inspired by Abe 's visit to Yasukuni Shrine in December .
#Text=Under Japan 's pacifist constitution , the country has not been able to engage in militaristic combat since the end of World War II .
#Text=CHAPTER II .
#Text=RENUNCIATION OF WAR
#Text=Article 9

#Text=Aspiring sincerely to an international peace based on justice and order , the Japanese people forever renounce war as a sovereign right of the nation and the threat or use of force as means of settling international disputes .
#Text=In order to accomplish the aim of the preceding paragraph , land , sea , and air forces , as well as other war potential , will never be maintained .
#Text=The right of belligerency of the state will not be recognized .
#Text=–
#Text=Constitution of Japan

#Text=Commenters related the move to escalated tensions with China , who had set up an Air Defense Identification Zone over a part of the East China Sea , including Japan 's Senkaku Islands , in November last year .
